intro: [WRONG START] Casia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian casaria, is a flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a central disk, typical of the family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Casasia haitiensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and traditional uses in local communities.
